intro: Adenosma thymus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thyme, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic, small, and often hairy leaves, which emit a distinctive scent when crushed. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and sunny environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and traditional herbal uses.
